reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
reviews.name: DWBelfils
reviews.title: The device is great. The everything else is not.
reviews.review: Everything about the physical device, i feel like is pretty well made. Good set up, some minor future issues that are mitigated by screen protectors and similar. Several easy to work with ways to play it, kinda fun in its novelties on its build.My issue?1) games are ridiculously expensive. So many are over priced.2) Online play required by Nintendo for a not good service is poor. Especially for things like minecraft.3) Where are any older games. The games that Nintendo has no need to keep out of the store. The old pokemon, Zelda games, or any games really. Like, great you are putting witcher 3 on there...But not Orignal Zelda and Ocherina of time?Physical? Great! Nintendo online and games? Bad. 1 or 2 games does not make the switch worth buying. PC has better prices, easier to work with, and you can play almost any game out there.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2019
reviews.name: Sherlockian
reviews.title: Love the Switch - A Casual Gamer's Best Console
reviews.review: This is my review of the 'V2' (2019) version of the Nintendo Switch (model #HAC-001(-01)).So a little background, I was a enthusiastic PC gamer in college who built my own PCs for the purpose and am now - due to the demands of adulthood - someone who only plays the occasional game. My last handheld Nintendo console was the black and white Game Boy Pocket in the early 90's, so I've been away from the platform ---- a while.I bought the Switch purely because I learned they had ported Skyrim to it, and as a huge fan of the Elder Scrolls genre I was hoping to devote some of my train commute to questing around Tamriel. In this sense, the Switch does not disappoint. I am not a graphics connoisseur, but - compared to the PC version - Skryim plays really well on the Switch. No perceptible lag, colors are crisp. Yes, it's missing the expansions and yes, the text can be a little small, but that's a fair trade-off for the portability this platform brings.So far, I only own 2 games - Skyrim and MarioKart 8 (another throwback to my college dorm days on the N64), and I love playing both on the Switch, MaroKart is obviously the newer game and so the graphics and gameplay are much better but I'm a still a sucker for Skyrim (at least until the next ES is released, hopefully in my lifetime).Anyway, all this to say the Nintendo Switch is a great console for busy adults who want to reminisce about the fun they had 10, 20, or even 30 years ago. The Switch doesn't take itself too seriously (which I love) but that means it might not be the right choice for people concerned with the perfect graphic or gameplay experience - there are dedicated consoles that do this much better. What the Switch does is make gaming on the go effortless, fun for the average busy person and something you can really enjoy with your whole family - which I think was Nintendo's real goal here all along.

Being a big Nintendo switch player what a great disappointment this was. Hopefully they improve this newer version system to where this does not happen again or to someone else.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019
reviews.name: Sam Lilly
reviews.title: (New) Nintendo Switch HAC-001(-01)
reviews.review: This revised model of the Switch comes with a number of features that I honestly can't fully appreciate as someone who didn't own the previous model. The big thing that drew me in was the extended battery life, even though so far I haven't played much in handheld mode and not at all in tabletop, but they use the same amount of battery either way I would imagine. The reason I'm giving this system five stars probably say more about how good it is than anything else. But I pretty much expected as much. I'm sure by now you can go online and find more detailed reviews for the gaming system, but in case you're wondering here, this one comes with the system, two gray joycons, two attachments to turn each joycon into its own controller, a base to connect both joycons into the formation of a singular controller, the required cables, and the Switch dock. So you'll probably want to buy a few things alongside this such as an SD card for reasonable storage space, a pro controller for a more standard controller experience, maybe a dock sleeve to prevent the possibility of scratching the screen from insertion and ejection of the system, an online pass if you plan to play any games with online features... just basically a lot of things that would be nice if they came with the system itself. This will inflate the price further, but the thing here is that this is going to replace the old models of the Switch and simply make this the main one manufactured now. So... basically, if you want a cheaper Switch you'll want to get a Switch Lite and this one will still cost about 300 bucks like the 2.5+ year-old original variant still costs. That is, unless you want to go used. I'm only bringing up these points because while this is a great system, I do think you should be aware of what is likely to happen with prices and availability going forward and plan accordingly. Once I realize a Switch was still going to cost the same if I wanted the ability to do on and off TV play I decided I might as well just hop on board with this newer variant. I'd recommend you do the same as it has had tweaks to make it just a slightly better version all around than the previous model. Otherwise, if price is a concern, wait for the Switch Lite and see how it tickles your fancy. Also, here's tip. If you want to turn the system off as opposed to leaving it in sleep mode, simply hold down the power button on the system for a few seconds and then a menu will appear with the option to restart or shut down. Also note that you cannot play on the TV off of the Switch's battery power. The dock needs to be plugged in for the dock to function. I hope something in here was helpful.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2019
reviews.name: C. Petit
reviews.title: Elegant compromise between handheld and console
reviews.review: In terms of raw horsepower (CPU, graphics, whatever) the Nintendo Switch is far behind the current generation of consoles like the XBox One.But, the Switch is a unique device.As a handheld, it is quite powerful (the latest iteration nearly doubles the handheld's battery life, addressing the Switch's greatest weakness).This allows you to play the same game on your TV and keep playing it as you take it out with you --- a unique ability.Most importantly, there is a staggering array of software available for it.Software is what makes or breaks a console, no matter how good it is.For example the Zelda game "Breath of the Wild" is a visual stunner with a huge open world.And this is the first portable system that has the full version of Skyrim available for it (the reason I bought it --- a high quality port of Skyrim with the 3 add-on packs).Nintendo has also done high quality ports of other gems from older consoles such as "Mario Kart 8" as well as a lot of new titles such as "Super Smash Brothers Ultimate" or "Luigi's Mansion 3".In addition,their digital store has a lot of quality indie games such as Stardew Valley.Also, if you purchase the Nintendo Switch Online membership ($20/year) Nintendo also gives you a large selection of NES and SNES classic games.The membership is worthwhile for that alone.Basically, because Nintendo is ONLY selling the Switch as a current console (the 3DS is on its way out), all of their best software goes to the one console.And that gives developers strong incentives to bring their best titles over as well.If you want a wide variety of games, the Switch is a good choice.If you want THE best console graphics or performance, obviously the Switch isn't for you.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
reviews.name: James Shaw
reviews.title: Used product. Disappointed.
reviews.review: I'll write the positives after I use it but thoroughly disappointed in amazon. The unit is clearly used and opened, there's a blue sticker on the outside, and it's covered in fingerprints. A shame. Three stars off the bat. Hopefully I like this thing. After I CLEAN it.EDIT: Now this review has become a one star. There's no joycon controller center piece in here. Absolutely terrible quality control

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2019
reviews.name: Chrissy
reviews.title: Best battery life, largest screen and HD rumble make this a better buy than the Lite version.
reviews.review: I don’t use this the way that Nintendo advertises; predominantly hand held.I have the Skull & Company Grip Case attached at all times and only play in handheld mode.The Switch Lite is too small and doesn’t have the HD rumble like this one has.This model is the better one with the longest battery life currently available.This is not designed with comfort in mind for handheld play sessions so the Lite may be a better option if comfort is important.If you get hand cramps like I do, I highly recommend the Skull & Company grip case.They also have a great travel case that you can get with it that has plenty of space for the switch with case and joycons attached and space for games, a power adapter and power bank.It is very good quality and the Switch is dockable with the grip case attached.The switch itself has a much faster, more user friendly, prettier, less congested graphics user interface than all of Nintendo’s previous consoles.It has a solid state drive for saving and downloading some games, and is expandable with the purchase of Micro SD cards for additional space.The online store is easy to use and probably the best Nintendo has ever had.Easy to sort by price, genre, developer.It is fast and easy to use and you can sort for free games and demos too.The load time between starting games and between cut scenes in game is very quick on hard drive, sd card, and game cartridge.Much quicker than nintendo’s previous consoles.I haven’t played with the joy cons detached so I can’t comment on how responsive the joycons are to movement and player interaction when joycons are detached.The HD rumble is more subtle than on PS4 and XBox but some games have used it very well.Mario Odyssey for example has done a great job of blending the environments in some levels to match well with the rumble feedback; its hard to explain, but this feels like the next step in controller evolution and PS5 and NextBox will be adopting a similar tech so more developers should get on board with HD Rumble in future games, hopefully.The switch buttons have a nice click and feel like they will last, much like most of Nintendo’s products but the stick feels a little looser than the PS4.I would like Nintendo to tighten that up for the Pro version.Overall, this is decades of Nintendo engineering in the making which has resulted in, arguably their best console to date.It is going to shatter console sales records for good reason.I highly recommend this version of the Switch for the battery life, larger screen and hd rumble, but you may want to get a comfort grip if you will be using it predominantly as a handheld.I no longer play on my 3DS because this is a much better player experience.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
reviews.name: The Big Smooth
reviews.title: Nintendo, Still a Thing?
reviews.review: I wish I could give negative stars for Nintendo. This was purchased as a gift for the kids for Christmas after recommendations from some friends. I still don’t get any appeal to Nintendo? We have only had it open for 2 days and already both JoyCons are complete toast. The drift in both is so bad that you can’t make right turns playing Mario Kart. I checked the calibration and followed a number of online tutorials for things to try, but to no avail. Come to find out, there is a class action lawsuit against Nintendo for this very problem. Apparently the solution is to send the controllers to Nintendo and wait a month for them to diagnose and maybe repair them. This is probably why I haven’t thought about the brand Nintendo for almost 20 years since I last owned any of their products. I’ve owned virtually every gaming console created and never once had this issue with any other controllers. If you are so desperate to play outdated video games with Nintendo level quality that enduring this garbage is worth it to you, then more power to you. I’m fine dumping this console in the trash and going back to forgetting Nintendo even exists for the next 20 years. I’ll stick to Xbox.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020
reviews.name: Kindle Customer
reviews.title: Great for younger kids or mobile gaming.
reviews.review: This is, strangely enough, the first portable system I have ever bought in my 30+ years of gaming. I’ve actually bought 2 Switches so far. The first one was a Christmas present for my son who I was trying to ease into video games. He loves it. After him having it for a year and me occasionally playing it to help him through areas where my greater experience with games could help get through certain areas, I was tempted to get one for myself to play when I had long periods of downtime at work. When Witcher 3 came out for the switch, I bought another one for me and have been playing it a few times per week since.My experience with the console is pretty much strictly in the handheld mode. I bought a Satisfye grip and case for my switch which allows me to hold the system more comfortably than I would without it. Holding the standard system and playing for more that 20 minutes or so causes my hands to cramp. The small joycons are just too small for adult male hands to use for long without some discomfort. I’m fine with that since the small size makes the system easier for kids, like my son, to use. A regular controller can be a bit bulky for a grade school age kid to use well. With the case and grip, this system is perfect for me to throw into my vehicle at work and forget about it until things slow down when I’m waiting for a call. Then I can break it out and pass the time in style.All in all, I have no complaints about the system, my son loves it and uses it constantly. I like it for its portable nature and surprising computing power. It is the first portable system I’ve experienced that didn’t feel like a downgrade or gimmick. The Switch instead feels like a true portable version of a larger console like PS4 or XB1. I still play on my PS4 far more than I do the Switch, but I can’t take that system to work and play in the office or car. If you have young kids, or a desire to game on the go with something better than your phone, then it’s hard to go wrong with the switch.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2020
reviews.name: Blake
reviews.title: It has its pros & cons..but more pros!
reviews.review: I bought the Switch a few months ago and now that I’ve spent some time with it (more than I’d like to admit ^_^) I wanted to leave a review.The Switch has many pros over other consoles, it’s main pro being that it’s a portable console with games that previously are only found on PC or console. I am a PC gamer and my PC is an absolute beast with an 8700K & 2080 Ti BUT the reason I bought a Switch is because oftentimes I am out and about and can’t bring my big honkin’ PC with me. Obviously I prefer my PC but it’s nice to be able to play games like Witcher 3 and thenwhen I have to go somewhere in the car or something I can seamlessly “Switch” to the Switch and continue my game.There are some absolutely AMAZING games on the Switch: Zelda: Breath of the Wild, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, Witcher 3, Splatoon, Super Smash Ultimate, etc., which are worth buying the Switch. This is especially true for people with kids as most of Nintendo’s big hits are kid friendly. You may not want your very young children to play violent games like Call of Duty or Battlefield 5 but they can definitely play a similar kind of game with Splatoon 2 only instead of shooting bullets to kill people they’re splattering paint all over each other.However the Switch also has its cons. Let’s start with Nintendo’s “E-Shop”. The E-shop sells games that are WAY overpriced. They charge $59.99 USD for games that have been out for years. The fact is you can buy physical copies of these games for less on Amazon AND you have the benefit of being able to resell the game later if you want too. Not so with digital games.Then there is the price. Yes the Switch is $299 which is cheaper than Microsoft and Sony’s consoles but when you factor in the cost of necessities that are almost required for optimal play (Pro Controller, SD card, Screen Protector) the cost adds up quickly.All in all though I do recommend the Nintendo Switch. It’s a great console for anyone who just wants to have a good time and it’s especially great for families or people with young kids who want to play games with them without worrying about violence, drug use, sexual situations, etc., that are in a lot of other games.5/5 Stars

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2019

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020
reviews.name: Vincent Steel
reviews.title: All hype - little value
reviews.review: I'm suppose to love the Switch, but I don't.I think it's a bad deal overall.1) Nintendo Online doesn't offer much compared to the Wii virtual console days.There's no Metroid games from the GC/Wii/Advance era.Nearly all the games for the switch look like something from the 90's when flash games were popular. But the games are priced as if they're made out of gold.2) The frame rate on this console is poor. Yeah, some games reach a respectable 30fps, but I'd say most games fall below that.3) The dock is very woobly, it doesn't lock in, and it's very easy to scratch up the screen.4) There is no wired connection out of the box.Why should I have to buy an adapter for that?If you play online seriously, you use a wired connection.5) Here's what really bugs me.There's no web browser on this thing.No web browser for a mobile device? Are you kidding me?This also leads to bizarre consequences.Since there's no reviews on the Nintendo store, you're forced to go to third party sites for reviews... but you can't, because there's no web browser.LMAO! And I had to create my nintendo account on a PC!ROFL!Conclusion:I'll stick with the PC, Xbox and Playstation.If these issues ever get resolved, I'll reconsider.It's an interesting design, but it's all hype - little value.$300 is way overboard for this gimmicky soy toy.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
reviews.name: Chris Dunn
reviews.title: Surprisingly enjoyable in handheld mode!
reviews.review: The switch is already of my favorite consoles I’ve ever owned. As an adult-I’ve been surprised by how much I play it in handheld mode. It’s nice to be able to sneak in some gaming time here and there at work when there is some downtime. And I actually find myself playing it in handheld mode pretty often at home when I’m watching football on the weekends. I’m glad I waited until this model with the improved battery life came out. Sometimes, I don’t have to put it on the dock to charge for 5 or 6 days, assuming I’m playing 30 minutes here and there. I highly recommend this system.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2019
reviews.name: Owen
reviews.title: Nintendo coming back to greatness
reviews.review: For quite some time Nintendo has been underwhelming when it comes to hardware specs on consoles. To the point that I switched to buying only the handhelds after the Gamecube. With the jump to an Nvidia GPU, not only does the bar for graphics get bumped up significantly from what Nintendo has released recently, it also allows third-party title developers the ability to bring their fun games to Nintendo for releases.Let's state that this isn't as powerful as the PS4 or Xbox One, but still has very good graphics. Not only that, but being able to undock it and play it like a handheld is an awesome feature. Switch Online, a service needed for online gaming, also includes NES and SNES titles you can play for free (included in the price really). My ONE issue, is that chat is needed through an external app. If this is done so the playing experience online requires less bandwidth in the rooms and therefore is smoother on the servers, than it makes sense. Otherwise, seems a bit annoying to have to need another device for it.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020
reviews.name: Spearra
reviews.title: Has flaws, but overall its a pretty solid system
reviews.review: This review is targeted at newcomers so for veterans of Nintendo products, not much new information here! As for everyone else looking at this gaming system wondering if its right for them, I'll do my best to explain what this model in particular brings to the table. In my particular case a: "Nintendo Switch with Gray Joy‑Con - HAC-001(-01)"Introduction to the system/What is a Nintendo Switch?:The Nintendo Switch is a "hybrid system". Lets break it down to its core do understand what people mean by "hybrid system", lets start with what is basically a gaming tablet with a plastic screen and a multi-touch-touchscreen. This is the "Switch itself" so to speak. For a "console", it is EXTREMELY thin in comparison to a PS4 or Xbox One for example. This also means it takes significantly less energy to run. The internal cooling fan is also significantly quieter than either of the prior two other consoles mentioned.That multi-touch-touchscreen allows for certain mobile games like Muse Dash, VOEZ, Deemo, and many others to be ported to the Switch without compromising their touch screen gimmicks from their mobile phone counterparts. Despite this, many of them do have support for button controls. Many Switch games gives you options on how you want to play and this is a running theme with the Switch.Now for the controllers which are "hybrid controllers" in a way. For those of you who used the Nintendo Wii, these "Joy Cons" share and improved upon the motion controls from the Wii days, except in addition to the motion controls, Nintendo also made the actual button layout resemble a regular controller like the button layout found on a Xbox One controller for example. Not that weird button layout on the Wii for example. This means both the Wii crowd can assimilate into this new generation of Nintendo, along side the core gamers who would prefer a more "traditional" controller button set up.Normally a player would use both Joy Cons together as a pair, whether that be attached to the Switch Tablet itself to be played on the go like a 3DS (be it much longer than a 3DS), at home and connected to a plastic grip that gives you those controller "thighs" to make it easier to hold and to make it feel more like a more traditional controller even more. You can even use the Joy Cons without them being attached to anything like the Wiimote and Numchuck, but without that annoying wire in between your controllers. This "detached" controller style option with the Joy Cons allows you to play in positions otherwise impossible with a more "static" controller. For example, you can play with one arm behind your head while the other arm is resting on your stomach as you play from your bed or couch.These Joy Cons also have two buttons on the plastic rails that connect them to the Switch Tablet piece. These buttons are functional and you can actually use just a single Joy Con per player in certain supported games.Key word "supported games". This is where the main issue with the Nintendo Switch lies, Nintendo laid the foundation for developers to have the best tools at their deposal but not all of them use them. Some developers have games that cost less overall on the Switch than their original releases on other systems, or from mobile with mobile's atrocious micro-transactions , meanwhile there's other developers that neither have the full game on the physical game cartridges while having the audacity to be more expensive on the Switch. But again, its ALL developer based. Research the game developers in question to see if you're getting the best value for buying their ports (or original) releases on the Nintendo Switch.Oh right, this gaming system uses cartridges. Don't worry, they're not those huge ones from the Nintendo 64 days! They're more Nintendo 3DS sized if anything. If the developer you choose did it properly, a entire game can fit on these cartridges. This means you can play those properly done physical releases immediately without any additional downloads. But again, developer based. Some of them DO only "partially" have the game on the Switch Cartridge(s). Do your research.Now to talk about the Dock that connects the Switch Tablet to a TV.If you open up the back side of the Dock, there should be two slits near the bottom of the Dock. The Switch Tablet has two air vents that when "docked" should be right up against those vents. Please try not to block off those vents so the Switch Tablet as a easier time cooling itself off while you (and others) play in "TV Mode". The Switch Tablet also has a air-vent on the top. So keep that area of the Switch Tablet clear as well.This particular model of the Nintendo Switch, model number "HAC-001(-01)", is different from day one Nintendo Switch systems in the sense that Switches with the model number "HAC-001(-01)" have better battery life. For example, day one Switches would run really graphically/resource intensive games for about 2 hours 30 minutes (or 2.5 hours) minimum. Whereas this new "HAC-001(-01)" numbered Switch(es) can run those games for up to 4.5 hours minimum in "handheld mode". The way these "new Switches" accomplish this is by having a more efficient component in the inside of the Tablet piece. This also means these new Switches are more energy efficient and less prone to overheating than the day one models. So this is even helpful for people who would use this gaming system for TV use.If you don't have a Switch yet, I recommend this model for its versatility. You never know when you'll change your mind on "how" you want to play. I used to use it mostly in TV mode but eventually started using it more and more while outside in general. For example, on the bus, while waiting for something to start whether it be a class, jury duty, meeting, you name it. The Nintendo Switch will make that wait all the less painful. Waiting to be called or dismissed for jury duty especially.Oh, I almost forgot! You CAN use power banks with the Nintendo Switch! The minimum power requirements for a power bank to work with a Nintendo Switch is 5 Volts, and 2.4 Amps. The cable you use to plug the Switch Tablet with a power bank can be found bundled with the Nintendo Switch Pro Controller, or the Nintendo Switch Charging Grip. Both of those products come with the USB cable required to use a Nintendo Switch with a power bank. So even if you manage to drain this new Switch's battery life on a long trip, bring a battery bank and you can extend its battery life even further. But again, this mostly won't be needed unless you're on a air ride for over 7 hours or so. Anything less than that, if you're smart about it, you can get away with just the Switch's battery life.Speaking of battery life, the Joy Cons each have a estimated battery life of 20 hours each. Let me repeat that, 20 hours. That brings its competition's controllers to shame!So if you keep your Joy Cons charged overnight (they charge when connected to the Switch Tablet while the Tablet is charging in either the Dock or via battery bank), they ain't going to die unless you deliberately go out of your way not to charge them at least once a week.When their batteries are completely dead, both the Switch Tablet and one pair of Joy Cons takes about 3 hours to fully charge everything. So if you're able to, put the Switch Tablet with the pair of Joy Cons connected to it, and leave the three of them in the Dock overnight to keep everything nice and charged for tomorrows challenges.Get creative, once you get used to the options the Nintendo Switch offers, going to anything else, you'll realize that you'd taken for granted with the Nintendo Switch! In my particular case, using the two Joy Cons in each hand unconnected. I can't do that with a keyboard and mouse! So get your Joy Cons, get them in a position that works for you, get cozy on your couch, bed, etc. and have some fun with your game(s) of choice!Just keep in mind it is a GAMING SYSTEM FIRST, and the "entertainment media center" SECOND. So as of January 15th, 2020 don't expect things like Netflix to be on this machine. If you treat it as a DEDICATED gaming system, you're in for one hell of a ride!Just don't forget your screen protector since the Switch Tablet's screen is made of plastic!If you don't want to go through all of them, get this one:https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B06XDWBPMZ/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1It should serve most peoples' needs. Its durable, cheap, anti-glare, self heals from minor scratches, etc. Its the most value for the price I've found from searching through all of what Amazon has as far as Switch Tablet screen protectors go.As far as the "system itself" goes, this is pretty much all of the information that you'd need. Everything else is developer centered, game wise. Do your research, and think very carefully which developers will give you the best bang for your buck!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2020
reviews.name: HeatherW
reviews.title: Be Patient!
reviews.review: I got this Gray version of the Nintendo Switch after a few months of hunting for retail price $299. There's a couple of websites out there that will notify you of in-stock. I happened to be able to grab it off of Amazon, but GameStop, Target, Walmart, Best Buy, etc, also have them as well. With it being in stock is rare, so you just have to look and be patient! Plan a few months ahead for birthday / xmas gifts so you have time to wait for a retail priced stock is in. Enough about the INSANE price gouging....I am very pleased with the Switch and am very happy with it. I have played on it for a week so far and everything is working fine and dandy, as it should. One gripe is that the storage capacity is small so only a few games can be played at a time, but with a micro SD card, possibilities are endless. I ordered one of those, and expect it soon so I can expand my downloaded game collection. I've enjoyed the Switch so much I'm getting some additional joycons and a grip and a charging station. I'm going to continue looking for accessories. Maybe a case I also had to get a TV adapter because my old TV only has one HDMI port, so I had to RCA to HDMI it up in order to not unplug and replug my Roku every time I want a bigger screen. How that goes is yet to be determined.I'm still figuring out how the dock station works (TV debacle), but for the most part - no complaints! I haven't played it with more than one person yet, but I'm positive that runs smoothly as well!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019
reviews.name: Jmac1493
reviews.title: Look for the Red Box
reviews.review: The red box tells you that this is the new model with twice the battery life. I never owned the previous model but I can tell you that I played in handheld mode mostly from 11:30 am to 4:30 pm with the exception of lunch, and I played 'til about 4 pm before I got the low battery warning. I watched a Youtube video that also showed that the colors on the screen are more accurate and the cooling system has been improved. So if you're wanting to play Witcher 3 on here, I recommend getting this one, as that power hungry game might warp the chassis from overheating. On top of that they are the same price right now, so I don't think anyone should get the old model until the price goes down.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
reviews.name: CHC
reviews.title: Disappointing for me.
reviews.review: On paper this is such a slick device, and combined with great Nintendo titles this was something I was excited for. BUT this system just isn't there yet. Right now I'm dealing with input lag that goes beyond controller or title specific issues. Right from the get go, setting it up (while in portable mode) felt odd. The touch screen and the attached joy-cons felt a bit slow. The input lag was the same speed as my PS4 with my TVs game mode OFF. Not a huge deal for many who will play most casual games, but annoying enough for me that titles like Cuphead and Enter the Gungeon are hindered. I do wonder if the newer portable only version doesn't have these issues, but I'm mainly interested in this as a home console.And it's online component? They still haven't caught up with Xbox Live from the 360 generation. Not a huge problem with Discord around, but still.Lot's of pluses for this system for sure, but this is mainly a message to people to try out the system first and decide for yourself if the input lag is bad enough to ruin your experience. A lot of people are very satisfied and don't even notice. I can see this not being a problem in games like Pokemon, or Mario + Rabbids Kingdom Battle. I've been playing "The Touryst", charming, relaxing, and a nice change of pace from what I usually play.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
reviews.name: Jack
reviews.title: Constant Hardware Failure
reviews.review: My screen was blank the first time i turned it on though I could still hear the sound of the menu.It took a call to Nintendo to figure out how to fix it.Not really what you expect from a $350 dollar product.I did a hard reboot and put it in maintenance mode to fix it which only worked for a few weeks.Now the screen is completely dead.This really doesn't look good for Nintendo's quality control seeing that the Switch failed to perform out of the box.Furthermore, I have had read numerous other stories online of people experiencing the same thing.Nintendo needs to get better hardware and quality control processes.The last Nintendo system I owned was an N64 which was a brick house and never had any problems.The Switch just feels cheap.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2022
reviews.name: Brandon
reviews.title: Nintendo review itself not the seller
reviews.review: Nintendo itself just sucks anymore.It's a proprietary console that offers now some of the worst games on the market.Metroid Dread being one of it's, yet again, biggest let downs.I bought this for 400$ for my child, because, "I was like hey I've played mario and duckhunt" when it first existed.Then came awesome zelda and metroid and etc.... but now... Metroid Dread is a complete let down.Mario makes my 7 year old irritated.He'd rather play Knack, Knack 2, or Planets vs Zombies.I was excited to let me child know there was a new awesome looking Metroid coming out, boom fail.For such an expensive proprietary system that no only offers crap games.... It's just not worth it anymore, I buy the new PS5

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2021
reviews.name: ☆ verace ☆
reviews.title: Price changing 24/7
reviews.review: I was gonna pay the outrageous price for the acnh switch but then I was like no that's messed up, why isn't it the same as when they first dropped?? Production cost couldn't have changed THAT much.So I ordered a black and grey one. Tell me why when there was 1 ain't switch left and I had already placed by order, the we're selling for the original 299?? Not only that but the jiycons break to easily anyways. My family has bought SO many.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2020
reviews.name: 20pagesaday
reviews.title: Broken the very moment I opened the box
reviews.review: Turned on the console for the first time and immediately received error code 2002-4153. I called Nintendo Support and I have to send it to their repair service. Didn't even make it to their profile setup. I have to wait 3 weeks now for it to return with the functionality that was expected upon purchase. Very disappointed.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021
reviews.name: Ron S
reviews.title: Defective Joy Cons
reviews.review: I purchased this for myself for Xmas, because I wanted to play with my kids.After about 4 hrs of game play, the left stick started drifting to the right.I mentioned it to my kids and they informed me that "stick drift" is a common issue with the Switch.Why would you pay for a product that that has a known defect that the manufacturer has no intention of correcting?Better yet, why would Nintendo sell one?The games are wildly overpriced.Games are less expensive and better on other consoles if you are hooking it to a TV.I have since returned it.I'm bummed.I was looking forward to having some family fun.I will not recommend this product to anyone.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
reviews.name: Matthew Welker
reviews.title: One of the Coolest Gaming Devices I’ve Owned
reviews.review: The only time I’ve used a Switch has been playing on one that my friends own. Just these experiences has really intrigued me into getting my very own Switch. I love playing video games and I own an Xbox and PS4, so I figure at some point it was time to complete the trifecta. While I’m more of an Xbox person, I will say I am very impressed by the Switch. It is a very simple console, but genius in of itself. I’ve had some Nintendo gaming devices here and there. A SNES back in the day, but mostly their portable ones from the Gameboy to the Advanced to the DS and 3DS. The Switch combines that of a home console and a portable gaming device and for that I love it. I can put it in the dock and play it on my TV. I can play it handheld which will be great for road trips or maybe just wanting to play anywhere. This was a brilliant move by Nintendo and it makes the Switch really stand on its own.Now what I’d say my favorite thing about the console is it’s simplicity. This device is made for one thing only and that is for playing video games. The console is both modern and old school at the same time. Would definitely recommend to anyone who really likes Nintendo and their games.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020
reviews.name: flytothemoon
reviews.title: I got this instead of the animalCrossingConsole from greedySellersPriceGouging
reviews.review: I got this instead of the animalCrossingConsole from greedySellersPriceGouging

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2022
reviews.name: C and A
reviews.title: Green Light of Doom!
reviews.review: We have been super careful with the Switch rarely undocking it and in less than a year we have the flashing green light of doom. The charging port on the Switch and the dock is so ridiculously delicate, I am completely flustered, it's not like we are dropping this bitch like a rock down a well!Worse from searching around this is something of a chronic issue. It seems so well made and solid, and it is except for this one critical design point. If I were paranoid I would say it was made to fail to milk customers for $$$$Get a warranty and keep it on speed dial.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2019
reviews.name: Book Worm
reviews.title: Innovative and fun.
reviews.review: Wonderful product. There are many minor hiccups that I already knew of before purchasing this product e.g. joycon drift, shakey joycons, hot while docked, online connectivity, dock scratch, etc. However, most of these risks i knew well ahead of time and so I was not bothered by them as most already have a diy fix for them as discovered by the Switch community. Great product, do some research before purchasing one, Nintendo methodology in developing their products can be a little strange at times but the good outweighs the bad with this product.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
reviews.name: A. Neary
reviews.title: A “can’t miss” for the casual gaming household
reviews.review: Our household doesn’t buy the latest, greatest gaming systems but it was time to upgrade our original Wii for another family friendly system. The reviews were pretty glowing for the Switch and I can say they’re warranted. Just make sure you buy the newer generation (this product) so you have better battery life and less decline over the life of the product.I love how Nintendo the Parental Controls essentially live within an app on the parent’s phone. A motivated kid can hack just about anything so keeping these settings non-local is a brilliant little safeguard. My kids have to ask me for “more time” when they’ve hit a daily limit (which is customizable for the day of the week). It’s very much like a simpler, more reliable version of Apple’s Screen Time feature on iPhones. Of course, you can also unlock more time on the switch itself using a pin code.It’s also worth mentioning that Nintendo did a great job with the “user assisted driving” feature on Mario Kart that helps young kids and inexperienced gamers be competitive. It really is nice to bring my youngest daughter into the joy of Mario Karting.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
reviews.name: Chosen Juan
reviews.title: Good portable system for the Nintendo exclusives.
reviews.review: I got two of these for a couple reasons:1. I wanted to upgrade my niece from her Nintendo DS.2. My niece loves Pokémon and knows I used to play when I was a kid so she raves about all she’s accomplished.3. I wanted to spank her in Pokemon battles accordingly and show her who the original master is.The system is great. I love the portable aspect, and the docking for a console. However, I don’t even use the portability anymore. I don’t like that Nintendo doesn’t have an achievement system like Xbox or Steam. So I’ll only play exclusives on Nintendo. Other games on multiple platforms, I choose something else.I’ll close with the fact that my plan backfired. My niece kicked my ass and now I don’t wanna play. Little twerp is always a step ahead, training while I work. I’m a sore loser and almost took a star off my review for losing alone.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2022
reviews.name: Henry
reviews.title: The Nintendo Switch
reviews.review: The Nintendo Switch if a one of a kind console or one might say a "Handheld Console". It is compatible with 3 different options which let you play by yourself or others on the go. Or the classic Nintendo way is to plug in it on the TV and play away.People might say that it's not great and it's very small and does not process as well as the New Xbox X or the PS5. But it's not supposed to be like that. It's meant for the Nintendo games. You can't play any Mario game or Pokemon game without the switch. Every other console is can't compare. There's a reason why it was never in the console wars. It does have any competition in its class. It is by itself and is very different. That's why I think the Nintendo Switch is one of a kind console and is very worth buying.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
reviews.name: IAmJoesMamma
reviews.title: Non- Gamer Mamma Review
reviews.review: Ok, here's a review from a mama that has no game. I know nothing about the console itself. Here are the things I do know. My son won Christmas. Opening this baby was a jumping, dancing celebration. He was very, very happy. The hubby had it up and going easily and quickly, and it went from box to play time in about 30 minutes. Be prepared to spend about $20 at start up to join Nintendo, and you get a couple packs of games, some looked retro to me. The battery life is amazing, seriously. We had a 4 hour road trip getting home after Christmas, and it held the charge the entire trip. Wow! I feel like it was a good purchase.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2021
reviews.name: TJB1215
reviews.title: Any issues you have must go through Nintendo...
reviews.review: So like the title says, any issue you have with the console or anything has to go through Nintendo. when I first got the system everything seemed to work fine. But after some gameplay I noticed that sometimes when i hit a button or move a joystick it doesn't always work. I chalked it up as user error and moved on. but now the problem is getting worse. so I go through the necessary steps to talk to Nintendo about getting a new one and they tell me all they can do is try to repair the joycon. And for reference I bought this system less than 2 months ago. so my brand new system doesn't even get brand new joycons its going to have rebuilt or refurbished. All in all very annoyed at the fact that i could have just bought a refurbished system and it would have been pretty much the same thing.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2021
reviews.name: Aj
reviews.title: Used!!
reviews.review: Product is used, controlers all scrached up. Cords filthy. Be aware! Of you want one like this buy it cheep from a second hand store.When I contacted seller about it they said it was listed as used in the procuct description. They offered a return instead of admitting that there disclosures are inadequate. I checked over all the information and no where is it currently stated that the switch is used.I would return but I live a hour away from the closest place I can drop off the return package.Avoid false advertizing and do not but from this seller!!!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2021
reviews.name: MsPANDORA
reviews.title: Some points - From months after purchasing
reviews.review: Awesome Console I get to run many games I've never gotten to play before, here's a few things:The screen and around it get items or "spots" Items and spots as it the tiny crack between the screen and the rest of the console, same goes with the speakers but you could use a toothpick or something small.The spots that I talk about look like if water or any other liquid had dried on the screen even though I never drink n play and they usually can be removed with ease(by rubbing) however I've had to use the backing of one of my rainbow pins to break it down so it could be scraped off with my fingernail. Thankfully it didn't scratch up the screen.Quality, certain games that are usually meant for quality look absolute garbage on switch(dbd, subnautica/below zero, etc). this usually can be fixed if you set it up on TV and up the quality or toggle with the settings however if you're on the go and wanna enjoy the game it'll be rather difficult. The Battery is still golden after a long time use! Pricing; when this console was bought it was 240-300 now its way more? This is a scam Nintendo!If anyone is looking for something like this just invest your money elsewhere like maybe the switch lite or one of the DS's. It's not worth it.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2021
reviews.name: Jaheen Ahsan
reviews.title: Situation Better than You May Think
reviews.review: First of all, I wanna say that although Amazon may have some date when they say it will be in stock or some date when they say it’ll be delivered, just know that it may be earlier than anticipated. I ordered mine thinking it wasn’t gonna be here untilaround June 4th, so about 3 weeks to a month after I ordered the switch, but fortunately, it came 2 weeks earlier! Apparently, I’m far from the only one who has experienced this, and a number of people have gotten their switch earlier than expected, so don’t look at the date thinking that’s when you’re gonna get it, ‘cause you may just get a nice surprise like a number of customers did. Yes, there are some stock issues with the switch at the moment as well as some production issues, but they are not as bad as they’re made out to be, so if you are thinking about getting the switch, go ahead and pull the trigger! Also, DO NOT BUY FRON SCALPERS. As some other people have mentioned, they will buy a switch and then sell it for a greater price than needed in order to make a profit, and although it may be tempting to buy from them so you can get it sooner, it is so not worth paying the extra money when the situation is actually better than amazon makes it out to be. Don’t do yourself a disservice and fall into the instant gratification trap. Be willing to wait a little bit longer for your switch. YOU’LL BE GLAD YOU DID.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
reviews.name: jean miller
reviews.title: Came with broken game card reader
reviews.review: When I first received the switch I was so excited. Everything was in the box and it looked brand new.At first I didn’t have enough to buy any physical games so I bought some games for sale on the E shop. And it worked great! But only till after the return date passed did I realize, the game card reader was broken! When I first played one of the games it seemed to work fine. But later when I removed the game and I inserted it again, it told me it couldn’t read the game card. Easy enough, just restarting the switch made it read. But now months have past and the only game card it seems to read is animal crossing. All my other games just wont read. Even a brand new copy of Minecraft. Since I believe I still have warranty, I wanted to contact Nintendo for repairs but it’s been shut down due to COVID. I hope I can get this fix. I’m very disappointed.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
reviews.name: Ronwsj
reviews.title: Fast shipping and great packaging
reviews.review: First things first I got my Switch from Mums Collectibles & Stuff so this will mostly be a review of them as I've already owned a Switch and knew what to expect from the system.What most people don't realize is that consoles are in high demand this year (2020) and we all know the reason so I can't fault a company for increasing the price on item due to high demand and low stock of said item. That being said Mums Collectibles & Stuff is by far the cheapest I have seen a new switch go for on amazon, ebay or a number of other websites.On top of all of this one I bought the item from them they had it ready and shipped the next day as I did buy it rather late at night. With an estimated arrival time of 2 weeks I actually received it a week early which I give my thanks to UPS. When I opened the package I found they took the time to make sure that the switch was secure and safe with two layers of massive bubble wrap which was just extra enjoyment.All in all they are the cheapest, quickest and most reliable source to get a switch right now.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
reviews.name: Michelle
reviews.title: Don’t buy from resellers! These restock often!
reviews.review: Glad to get one at retail price! This is by far the most fun system on the market today. If you see one for sale at $299.99 or less BUY IT! Just keep checking! That’s what I did. Try sites like zoolert (google it) to let you know when they’re in stock! I have faith in you!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2022
reviews.name: Josh
reviews.title: Excellent!!!
reviews.review: Seller got the item to me super fast thru Amazon.Was no need to do a bunch of updates and downloads requiring hours of boredom before playing as it is with my Xbox. Totally fun in every way plus the older game system downloads available with additional upgrade to the nintendo online, and the games with the old system downloads are awesome. One of my favorite parts of this system. And seamless swapping from TV to handheld device is great. All around an excellent system for any type of gamer wanting to just have fun.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2019
reviews.name: Brooke
reviews.title: Worth it.
reviews.review: I don’t know about you but I battled with getting the Switch for ages. I wasn’t too sure if the price of the device was worth it or not but I eventually bit the bullet and bought it and I have no regrets.I like how the device can be hooked up to your tv or you can bring it with you on the go. Right now as I get settled in a new place I’ve been bringing it with me on the go, sometimes I’m on campus and there’s nothing to do or I’m waiting in between classes so I just whip out my Switch and begin to play.It was worth it for me, I am waiting for more games to arrive for the Switch but there is a decent selection of games to choose from.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020
reviews.name: Ty
reviews.title: Seller was great and console works perfectly
reviews.review: I love my Nintendo switch. Even though it was overpriced, I understand that it is due to low supply due to the pandemic so I am not that upset about it as the console has been working perfectly and came with everything advertised. The only problems I ran into were low memory and short battery life on the device but those were easily fixed. The seller was also very helpful and the switch arrived much earlier than expected and on my birthday, coincidentally. Definitely worth its original price ($299) and even though the rise in price is disappointing and definitely pricey, I would argue that its also somewhat worth it. Playing on this is a good way to spend lockdown, so I don't regret making this purchase.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
reviews.name: Ayla Urul
reviews.title: LOVE my switch!
reviews.review: I LOVE my new gaming system!!! I don’t care about the simplistic things like the color scheme of the others or how many GB it has. I’m just glad I could even get it! One thing I will say is that when I first bought it, it said not in stock until December 21st. Which was fine, I get it when I get it. But it came like 2 weeks earlier! So if you’re thinking about buying, don’t wait. It might truly be out of stock if you do! I really, truly don’t have any cons otherwise. Thanks Nintendo, you made an updated DS player very happy.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2020
reviews.name: Holly W.
reviews.title: I love my switch!!
reviews.review: I now have two of these consoles and, if needed, would buy a third. I love my switch so much. It is by far my favorite console. The ease of switching it from the handheld to the tv is flawless. The battery life on the new consoles is much better than the previous model which is great. I gave my old model to my three-year-old who loves playing this console as much as I do! Every morning, the first thing he says when he wakes up is "Can I play my game?" So it really is a great console for all ages! Would buy again and again!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2021
reviews.name: TechNolajG
reviews.title: Be careful when buying used!
reviews.review: I just had a bad experience with my purchase of this product from a seller that goes by CellularStream.Not only did I pay just about full price for a USED Nintendo switch, it also had a permanent ban. I'm returning it today due to there not being any way to lift the ban (I contacted Nintendo support via phone and they said there's nothing they can do.) I advise anyone that is buying used consoles to be wary of the seller. The only thing that was noted in description was that it wouldn't come in it's original packaging, nothing about it being a permanently banned console that restricts you from online features. It's a clear scam due to the price it was sold for. Now if it were $100 or something that made sense (with proper description) then I would've been able to take my losses and not leave a review like this.This review doesn't reflect my opinion on Nintendo at all, my star rating is strictly based on my buying experience from CellularStream.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020
reviews.name: Daniel Lopez
reviews.title: One Year Later as a Switch owner
reviews.review: I’ve had my Switch for about a year now and I can say it’s a very fun console. It’s no where near as powerful as the PS4 or Xbox but the fact that I can take my games on a road trip or play it at home is pretty awesome and convenient for gamers. The Joy-Cons do get loose however over time and will slide off without having to press the release button so I would recommend getting a grip or a case like the picture shown above. Another thing I wan to mention is the joy con drift, which can get really annoying at times. Having to calibrate them in the settings menu every other minute can be really annoying and for others, ruin the experience. I usually use a pro controller while playing on docked mode and I don’t run into any issues but the problem persists when I’m playing on table top or handheld. Besides the minor inconvenience here and there, I think the Nintendo Switch is great, especially with third party games like Skyrim or the Witcher 3 being ported over to the Switch. It’s a great little console.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
reviews.name: Justin Seter
reviews.title: Loving the Switch!
reviews.review: I travel often for work, so needed something to do in hotels and long flights. The Switch hits the mark. This newer version has great battery life, i never had the old one with the shorter life, but no complaints on this one.I immediately jumped in with the old NES and SNES games you can get by subscribing to the online platform. They look great and play great. Also have been playing Link's Awakening and Super Mario Odyssey, beautiful games and looking forward to more.Seamless switching between big screen and small screen is really impressive.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
reviews.name: Melissa Smith
reviews.title: Came missing Charger, was dirty, and it was a used product instead of new
reviews.review: -was advertised as new was actually a used product-was dirty when I pulled it out of the box, hair and smudges covered it when I pulled it out of the box-didn't have the charging cable with it-the device data wasn't even deleted, it had previous users profiles and data still on it

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
reviews.name: Jacob
reviews.title: Never owned a Nintendo? It may not be worth it.
reviews.review: There are not many games worth playing on the Switch. If you have kids your probably ok but as an adult, I quickly got tired of Animal Crossing. Legend of Zelda is good, but there is not much else besides 7 different Mario titles and Super Smash Bros. My take: don't get this system unless you really like the nostalgia of these older franchises or have kids.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
reviews.name: Ayah Muted
reviews.title: Awesome quarantine pickup
reviews.review: I already own a Switch but wanted to pick one up for my fiancee to have fun during quarantine. She is someone who has never played video games and didn't like them on the few occasions I tried to play a multiplayer game with her. Managed to pick up a used one (that looked virtually new) from Amazon Warehouse for about $240, which was a steal. She is really enjoying it and slowly becoming a regular gamer (1-2 hours a day), and the Switch has several games that are great for newcomers. She prefers handheld mode while I almost exclusively play it on my TV, so having that option is awesome.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2020
reviews.name: GaCruc
reviews.title: Malfunctioning Switch: A Switch Lite Pretending to be a Switch
reviews.review: I received a Switch that is unable to connect to the TV, so, it's pretty much just a more expensive Switch Lite.After an insane amount of troubleshooting, I was finally told by Nintendo that the product was defective.Nintendo wanted me to ship it in for repairs, THE DAY AFTER I BOUGHT IT.So instead of offering me an exchange, they want me to send in my BRAND NEW SWITCH for repairs.Kind of ridiculous if you ask me, they should have replaced my Switch no questions asked.On top of that, Amazon is not offering exchanges either. I am very disappointed that neither company has a reasonable solution for defective Switches. I will be returning this Switch, and I can tell you, it definitely wasn't worth the headache trying to get my hands on it.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
reviews.name: WeLikeFastCars
reviews.title: New Version with Extended Battery!
reviews.review: I sold off my old Nintendo Switch, and picked this up at a discount. I tried to sell to gamestop, but they're not very clear on if they give you the full $250 they where advertising. So I opted to sell it online. The great thing about the new version is the significantly longer battery life. It's quite impressive. Here's to hoping they come out with a Switch Pro version with bigger/better screen :)

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
reviews.name: lonnie
reviews.title: loving it
reviews.review: price was jacked up but its a very good system. seller packaged the item well. only complaint is ups sucks stop using them the guy got in hids truck on my block and was bout to roll off i said "hey excuse me you dont have a package for this address? he said "ummm i have to find it. ill come back after i find it" and and rolled off down the street. i went back in the house and sat on my sofa for maybe 3 seconds and i see him at my door with my package !! i dont trust them what so ever, i believe if i didnt say anything i wouldnt have got my package

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2021
reviews.name: MnH
reviews.title: Whats not to love
reviews.review: Nintendo fans, newbies, kids, veterans, you name it theres a game on the switch for them. Its a fun system that you can travel with and it works very well in both tv or travel mode. Our family loves all the pokemon and mario games they have. Its a fun console and we are thrilled to have gotten one knowing that they are usually a bit hard to find. This system is a 10 out of 10 for fun for the family

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2019
reviews.name: Meli Bailey
reviews.title: Exactly What I Ordered
reviews.review: Me and my family have only just received it and it is awesome.So far, the battery does seem to be lasting a bit longer and for the casual gamer, like me, I'm enjoying it.I was slightly worried that I wouldn't get the updated version, but it wasn't an issue.I got exactly what I ordered.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2021
reviews.name: Kevin Putnal
reviews.title: I wish i own it sooner!
reviews.review: I did wish i own it sooner since it is coming up on 5th year i think but same time i am glad i waited. There are some port games that been on other consoles like PS4 and Xbox as much PC but also i am glade it has its own awesome library of games. The online i do agree with people saying the online stinks but still good to have and have good time with family and friends on the go or at home.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2021
reviews.name: Matthew Webb
reviews.title: A step in the right direction
reviews.review: While I did crack under the pressure of price gouging during the earlier height of the pandemic in late-April, I’m so happy that I finally have my switch. I don’t need WiFi to play most of the games that I’m interested in such as Fire Emblem or DragonQuest.I will say that I wish that the Switch had more streaming options other than just Funimation, Hulu, or YouTube. It hardly matters though because Nintendo was definitely out to make this a gaming console.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020
reviews.name: Sarah
reviews.title: I LOVE MY SWITCH!
reviews.review: I’ve had a Nintendo Switch before, but I just replaced it and it came today! No damage was done to the console or any of the accessories inside as I got it out. Feels just as I remember it. I’m sooo excited to be playing Zelda again! The only thing I was unhappy about was that the delivery guy didn’t follow instructions I left to knock and ring doorbell. It was also raining and the step he left the packages on were getting wet. So I spent $320 on this just so it could have potentially gotten ruined if I hadn’t seen the truck or got a notice it had been delivered. Other than that, I love it!!! Highly recommend!!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
reviews.name: Asset
reviews.title: The games are more expensive than the console
reviews.review: The build quility is good. The are some good titles.But mostly eshop is full of trash indie titles for unreasonable $15All worth playing games are $60.Old PC ports run at lower than mid PC resolutions and cost 3-4 times more expensive than in Steam.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
reviews.name: Jaiana
reviews.title: So happy with my purchase
reviews.review: I can play and explore in games for 7+ hours before needing to connect to the charger. The transition from handheld to tv display is almost seamless (just a slight lag before the display pops up on the tv). I love being able to stay and play at home or take it on the go with me.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Great Console for a Busy Life
reviews.review: When I was little I used to be able to spend all day playing games. Of course as I got older, my amount of free time decreased exponentially. If, like me, you need to balance your job and college life but still want to play games, this console is a really great choice. It's loaded with tons of pick-up-and-play games that are great for quick 30 minute sessions. The handheld mode makes it really accessible and portable, and the new model has a great battery life. My only big complaint is that the controllers when in handheld mode don't always feel securely attached to the sides of the console. There is a small amount of wiggle if you move the console that is not really enough to bog down the experience, but is still noticeable enough to feel sort of cheap. Overall though this is a great console for a busy young adult still trying to find time for their favorite hobby and I highly reccomend it if you're interested.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
reviews.name: Sydney
reviews.title: Do you Remember when Video Games were Just Fun?? (and not for ignoring a mass pandemic)
reviews.review: One of the joycons is a little weird but like, wow!! My little animal crossing machine is working really good to let me keep my mind off this whole quarantine thing!! I've had it for a few weeks now and my friends were wondering if I died.Not many downsides, There's lots of games to play on here since the switch has been out for a while and it doesn't even have to be connected to a tv to let you play. If you know a kid who loves video games but you don't want your 9 year old to get shouted at for being bad at video games by 20-somethings that want to win games after work, this little guy doesn't have voice chat so you don't need to worry.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
reviews.name: Alando McGreggor
reviews.title: Defected
reviews.review: Defected. Control keeps scrolling right. Seems like this is a common problem after some research. Was excited to come home and play PokeMon Shield. This ruined my night. Will be returning all items that I bought due to frustration.Update: instead of returning I went on YouTube and found a fix for my controls. After getting that fixed, I'll have to say this is by far the best system I've ever purchased.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
reviews.name: Ahmed Hamoudi
reviews.title: Missing items
reviews.review: So I rarely leave reviews but this needed a review, I buy over 40 switches a month for my business, and this the first time I opened the shipping box and I was taking the box out before opening I heard some noise and box seemed light... I know how heavy they usually are and never have I heard some noice upon holding the box. I opened the box and this is literally what I see... looks like a horrible mistake and I’ve read other reviews SAME ISSUE SHIPPED AND SOLD BY AMAZONat least they helped me out but still horrible

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2021
reviews.name: Travis Johnson
reviews.title: Everything works as expected!
reviews.review: I was skeptical, as always, when dealing with an online seller and used products. Absolutely nothing wrong with my unit whatsoever. No physical damage, came with everything as specified on the description, screen works great (no scratches and crystal clear), all of the buttons are crisp and the battery life is what I would presume right out of the package would be.Basically a brand new switch for a used price. Very happy with my purchase, 5/5 stars all day long

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
reviews.name: 1Aquin
reviews.title: Portabilidad excelente
reviews.review: Portátil, Buena consola, nueva y perfectas condiciones pero los juegos en la tienda digital, esta muy caros. Además no puedes prestar tu cuenta y que jueguen con la cuenta del titular.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2019
reviews.name: Brad The Man
reviews.title: Amazing hybrid console.
reviews.review: Love the thing, being able to play a lot of these games at home or out and about is definitely a winning situation. I can't compare the battery life to the previous Switch but I haven't had a chance to kill it yet so great job Nintendo.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019
reviews.name: RS
reviews.title: Switch defective but Amazon helpful in setting up a return and replacement
reviews.review: Switch (main screen portion) was warped upon receipt. The back side slightly bulged out while the screen side was concave and bent inward. I’ve never seen this issue before on another Switch. Didn’t realize this problem until a few days after receiving when I was installing a screen protector on the Switch. Set up a return and replacement of the Switch through Amazon. I assume this issue is simply a manufacturer defect and hope the replacement doesn’t have the same problem.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
reviews.name: Heidi
reviews.title: A worthwhile purchase with hours of fun for the whole family
reviews.review: I took a break from gaming consoles before I got this. My last home system was a PS3 and my last handheld was a Nintendo DS. I couldn’t find any games I was really into or anything that seemed worth my time. I got the Switch after having seen my friends using it and after a few minutes of playing Breath of the Wild. Let me tell you.... this system is wonderful!! You’re really getting two systems in one!! Being able to play on the go as well as just plug and play is such a wonderful concept. Not to mention the game options and variety. I’ve played over 70 hours of Breath of the Wild, and loved it. The other indie games available are also great additions. Overall, it’s a great system. Worth every dollar. I haven’t had this much fun with a gaming system in a while. Great job, Nintendo!!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
reviews.name: Juan Manuel Lopez
reviews.title: Tuve problemas con la forma que enpacaron
reviews.review: Le equipo funciona muy bien y sin fallas en mi caso particular el equipo llegó en una caja de Amazontodo en una bolsa plástica con otro pedido que vino tinto con eso sin la caja original y sin manual la caja de Amazon era más pequeña que la caja del Nintendo no entiendo cómo sele ocurrió hacer eso al que realizó el empaque hice el reclamó y si Amazon se ofreció a qué realizará la devolución pero era navidad y era un regalo para mi sobrino y tuve que dejarlo así

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2021
reviews.name: TiffaniBri
reviews.title: I love my switch!
reviews.review: I got this as a gift for my birthday so that I can upgrade from my switch lite, and I love it! I have a projector instead of a tv in my room and it connects to it perfectly. This was a great purchase (and I recommend animal crossing and mario 3d world if you want some fun and time consuming games!)

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
reviews.name: Bean Mathews
reviews.title: Incredibly fun! Can also use parental control to track playtime and protect console from siblings
reviews.review: I bought this just to play Animal Crossing: New Horizons, and it didn't disappoint in the least! It's incredibly fun!One cool feature is that if you set up Parental Control using the free app, it will tell you how long you've played each day. Since I'm neither a parent nor do I need to be controlled, I disable restrictions and play-time limit so it doesn't actually interfere when I'm playing, but it is a bit sobering to see that yesterday I played for 6 hrs and 40 min.Also, if you set the play-time limit to 0 min everyday, the console will prompt you to disable Parental Control via a PIN. This could come in very handy if you have a sibling or roommate who likes to steal your Switch.I would also recommend getting a screen cover, either plastic or glass. I have a glass one that adheres like a second screen and haven't had any trouble yet, but then again I've only had it for 8 days and treat it very carefully.Overall, a great product, and worth every penny!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021
reviews.name: Jake Hawfield
reviews.title: "like new"
reviews.review: Bought this as it was labeled "like new", and was my only option for getting a switch. Upon delivery, one joycon controller was broken ( no peg to lock it in and not even holding a charge) the screen is also scratched, as well the back of it, and it's missing the controller attachment for the joycons. It's like it wasn't even checked before it was sent.Tldr; switch came with a completely broken joycon, scratches on screen and back(not a super huge deal, just annoyed because the lable of like new), and it's missing the controller for the joycons.Edit: changed to 4 stars. Fast reply and a refund which is enough to replace the missing/damageditems.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2022
reviews.name: jason
reviews.title: Definitely used!!
reviews.review: Had scratches on screen under protective cover.Didn't come in original box. All components thrown in box in a ziploc bag separately and box was taped shut. Very disappointed. Better off buying new. Worth the money.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020
reviews.name: AlexBoss
reviews.title: BE CAREFUL
reviews.review: THE PRODUCT I RECEIVED WAS PREVIOUSLY USED!!! IT HAS PARENTAL PASSWORD, ONE CONTROL DAMAGED AND SINCE I GAVE IT AS A BIRTHDAY PRESENT A MONTH AFTER RECEIVED IT, NOW I CAN'T RETURN IT.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020
reviews.name: RJ
reviews.title: After 1 Month I'm beyond Happy
reviews.review: Haven't own a Nintendo console since the Wii. I really wanted something I could play bowling, tennis, Mario etc and after finally pulling the trigger I can say 100% I'm in love with the Switch. My wife and I play every single night and it's great to bring on trips. I wish it was easier to travel with and you didn't need the dock and could just use a USB-C to HDMI but other than that even if you're a casual gamer this is a must have.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2022
reviews.name: C. John Buchanan Sr.
reviews.title: great purchase
reviews.review: Shipped well, no damage. Kid loves it. Priced normal. Shipping was faster than expected which is awesome. Always better to get something earlier then anticipated rather then later. Plus it was a Christmas gift so plenty of time to wrap it up.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2021
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Defective Unit - barely used, charged for “repair”
reviews.review: Rarely used the product in the past year and now that I want to use it 3 months later. The system does not work, battery is damaged?now needs a repair that will cost $99, then they lowered to $30+ tax & shipping.Extremely upset about the fee and the lack of quality of a product. Never had an issue with a Nintendo product but not purchasing another unit.Unit is brand new & now needs to be repaired.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2021
reviews.name: JessicaB
reviews.title: SCAM SCAM SCAM
reviews.review: THIS IS A SCAM! THE ITEM INSIDE DOES NOT MATCH THE PRODUCT! THERE WASN’T EVEN A CONSOLE SCREEN, IT WAS A OFF BRAND, PERSONAL TABLET! DO NOT BUY! WILL BE RETURNING IMMEDIATELY!!!!! ONE SECTION OF THE BOX WAS FILLED WITH NOTHING BUT WHITE CLOTH!!!

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2020
reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Switch my joy cons please
reviews.review: I finally found a new Nintendo Switch on Amazon. I wasn’t happy how the price for a basic gray one was double the price, but I hoped for that price everything would be working perfectly. It was brand new in the original box and wrapping. Unfortunately, both joy cons have an issue with on button that it doesn’t work everytime you press the B and Down button.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2020
reviews.name: Jack Bettilyon
reviews.title: Left joycon came with drift
reviews.review: The center console itself was fine - it was actually the newer version (XKW) with longer battery life. However my joycons were very clearly heavily used, and the left one had drift so severe it was useless. It’s not too much of a hassle to get replacement parts from other sellers, but it is frustrating having to wait another week to use my new switch.Aside from the joycon issue, it was packaged nicely and shipped quickly with all parts accounted for. I’m sure once my replacement part comes in I’ll be more than satisfied with this purchase.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019
reviews.name: Daniel
reviews.title: One of the most influential devices of the decade
reviews.review: The product is fine and the shipping was fast.However, the box was not sealed which indicates that somebody opened the box.I ordered this to make sure and get the newer switch with the longer battery life and also to get another dock.I have not done so yet, but I will be checking to make sure that somebody did not switch an old switch of the new switch in my "brand new"open box.It seems quality control was lax here.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
reviews.name: HR
reviews.title: Awesome family console
